status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"774eo","text":"Nodose ganglia are dissected and flash frozen in liquid nitrogen.Store at -80C until ready to isolate nuclei.Grind up the sample with liquid nitrogen using the 1.5mL centrifuge tube and fitting pestle.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cm3lf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ch181","text":"Add 500 ul Lysis Buffer to pulverized tissue, pipette 10x up and down and place on ice","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"26h26","text":"Incubate 5 min with the overhead shaker in the cold room","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"2lfvb","text":"Spin down 5 min 500g at 4C using soft settings. Remove supernatant","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"deudt","text":"Resuspend tissue in 400 ul Sorting Buffer by pipetting 10x up and down.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ec4r4","text":"Filter with a green 30 um CellTRic (Sysmex) into FACS tube. Wash filter with another 200 ul SB. Gently clap rack against bench to fully transfer the nuclei suspension. Add 6 ul DRAQ7 (Cell signaling) to stain nuclei and place sample on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4mmpv","text":"For collection of sorted nuclei add 50 ul Collection Buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1pdda","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ce5k8","text":" to a 1.5 ml LoBind tube (collection tube).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"37imv","text":"Use 100 um Chip for sorting of nuclei","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bl2j1","text":"Set temperature for sample and collection to 5C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fl3vf","text":"Identify single nuclei based FSC/SSC signals andDRAQ7 fluorescence in FL-6 (PE-Cy7) channel","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"asvis","text":"Sort 60,000 (200 ul) nuclei (Gate: “Sorting”) with the setting “Purity” into the prepared collection tube.  After sorting is finished (10-20 min), mix sample and keep on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b1inl","text":"Spin down 15 min 1000xg at 4C (Using swinging bucket rotor). After centrifugation, there should be a tiny blue pellet be visible. Remove supernatant and resuspend in 18 ul RB by pipetting 10x (Recovery of nuclei should be around 50-60%). Leave sample on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ar2g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cjta","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5ef02","text":"Check for single cell suspension and count nuclei using hemocytometer. Mix 5 ul sample + 5 ul Trypan blue and count 4 big squares. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4dcrm","text":"Calculation: (counted number)/4*20=nuclei/ul). Adjust concentration to 1000 nuclei/ul.  Follow 10xGenomics library prep protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
